title.narrative: CHILD FRIENDLY JUSTICE

description.narrative: By 2015 government enacts revised legislation that introduces intersectoral coordination and alternatives to custodial service for children in conflict with the law, which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, more children from excluded and poor families benefit from equal access to education and protection systems

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/04/001 EQUITY AND SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015 government enacts revised legislation that introduces intersectoral coordination and alternatives to custodial service forchildren in conflict with the law

description.narrative: Prohibition of detention of UASC, Draft Diversion from Criminal Proceedings and Implementation of Alternative Measures Act (DDCPIAMA) included in the legislative agenda of the new Government and strengthened capacity of police officers, prosecutors, judges and lawyers working with children in judicial proceedings. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of Prosecutors' Offices and Regional and District Courts with specialized units and panels dealing with cases involving children

target.value: 2017:8 Prosecutors' Offices and 15 Regional and District Courts pilot specialized units and panels by 2017

actual.value: 2017:6 Prosecutors Offices and 7 Regional and District Courts.

title.narrative: : Status of the enactment of a Juvenile Justice Act that incorporates inter-sectoral coordination mechanisms and integrated alternatives to custodial services for children in conflict with the law

target.value: 2017:New JJ legislation is elaborated in the period 2016 - 2017

actual.value: 2017:Draft Act on Diversion from Criminal Proceedings and Implementation of Educational Measures for underage offenders) included in the legislative agenda of the Government for the first half of 2018, Pending adoption by Council of Ministers and introduction to Parliament.

title.narrative: Training materials for justice professionals address the capacities of children, including young children and children with disabilities, to voice their opinion and give evidence in judicial proceedings, and the need for communication with children to be gender- and culture-sensitive.

target.value: 2017:Training material for justice professionals with explanations of children's capacities to voice their opinion and testify in courts, including young children and children with disabilities are included in the programme of the National Institute of Justice

actual.value: 2017:Training materials developed by UNICEF and the Ministry of Justice to be included in the curricula of the National Institute for Justice in 2018/2019 school year

title.narrative: Training materials for justice professionals address the capacities of children, including young children and children with disabilities, to voice their opinion and give evidence in judicial proceedings, and the need for communication with children to be gender- and culture-sensitive.
